medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient presented with visual impairment due to suspected left global rupture after falling onto concrete and suffering a stroke.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began on the same day of her fall, which led to the immediate referral to an ophthalmologist. Upon initial visit, her best-corrected visual acuity (BCVA) was 1.2 in her right eye and hand motions in her left eye. Intraocular pressures (IOPs) were 13 mmHg OD and 38 mmHg OS. Postoperatively, BCVA improved to 1.2 bilaterally, with IOPs of 16 mmHg in the right eye and 13 mmHg in the left eye.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a history of uncomplicated bilateral phacoemulsification cataract surgeries and intraocular lens (IOL) implantations more than 10 years previously.
